If you have already paid your full year’s tuition prior to receiving an award, you will now see a negative balance on your account. Once the add/drop deadline for the fall semester has passed, you can contact our office to request a refund.

dialog_nodes.conditions: @Financial_Aid_Osap:(received a scholarship) && @Financial_Aid_Osap:(How do I get that money)

values.text: The university has an award of recognition entrance scholarship program for incoming domestic students. If you have been out of high school for less than 18 months, and have a minimum entrance average of 85 per cent in your top six 4U- or M-level courses, you are eligible to receive funding. There is no application required.

General bursary applications will begin to be assessed following the application deadline, this information can be found on MyCampus.. All assessments will be completed before December 1. Prior to this date, applications will not be assessed unless you are facing a financial emergency.
Here is a link on how to pay: https://registrar.uoit.ca/fees-and-payment/payment/
This change will take effect for the fall 2019 semester. Once you register for courses, you will be able to opt out of select fees. Please ensure you opt out prior to the deadline.

Scholarships and bursaries are types of financial assistance that you do not have to repay. They are considered income by the Ontario Student Assistance Program (OSAP) and need to be declared on your OSAP application, unless you have been notified in writing that the award will be reported on your behalf.

Confirmation of enrolment will begin no sooner than 10 days before the start of classes for the upcoming semester. Your enrolment will be confirmed automatically as long as you meet the following criteria:

    - All required supporting documentation in your OSAP account has been submitted and approved.
    - Your program, course load and year of study indicated on your OSAP application match your school file.

Once your enrolment has been confirmed, it typically takes 5 to 10 working days for your funding to be released.
As a result of recent changes to provincial legislation, students now have the choice to opt out of select ancillary fees.

We recommend you apply for OSAP 8 to 10 weeks before the start of your study period. You can also apply before you are accepted into your program. The online application includes information about all of the OSAP deadlines. If you miss these deadlines, your application will not be processed.

f you will be studying full-time in the spring/summer semester (three or more courses over the entire semester) and you received full-time OSAP for the fall/winter semesters, you are eligible to complete an OSAP summer extension.

If you withdraw from courses and receive either a full or partial refund for the dropped course(s), the refund must be sent back to the NSLSC to help pay back any funding that was released, for which you are no longer eligible.
Course registration for the fall and winter semesters takes place at the end of June. Students that are eligible to register will be sent an email with further information closer to this time.

1. Log in to MyCampus.
2. Click on the Awards and Financial Aid tab.
3. On the right-hand navigation bar, under Helpful Links, select Start my application.
4. Click on Apply for Student Aid.
5. Select your aid year and aid period from the drop-down menus and click Continue.
6. Select your appropriate general bursary application from the drop-down menu.

The select fees you can opt out of go toward your Student Union, clubs and societies, on-campus events, and the refugee sponsorship program. You can view a complete list of ancillary fees, including the fees you can opt out of.
Awards, bursaries and scholarships are not considered taxable income, but must be reported to the Canada Revenue Agency through T4A forms.

You can check your account detail by term on MyCampus to see your tuition fees. Then, check your OSAP account to see the amount of OSAP funding set to be distributed for the semester. If your OSAP funding is greater than your tuition, and you have submitted all required supporting documents, you do not need to take any further action—we will place a deferment on your account for you. If you have less OSAP funding than tuition, you will need to pay the difference by the payment deadline.
Award of recognition entrance scholarships are applied in two instalments: 50 per cent in the fall semester and 50 per cent in winter.
Some services and resources are central to the operation of the university and the student experience. These fees are mandatory to ensure access for everyone.

If you are receiving enough OSAP to cover your tuition, an OSAP deferment will be placed on your account. An OSAP deferment will prevent any holds and late fees on your account until your enrolment has been confirmed and the funding sent to the university. It is your responsibility to check your tuition account and make sure that your OSAP funding has been received, and that fees have been paid in full for the semester.
Award applications for the upcoming academic year will be posted in August. In the meantime, you can check out the SAFA website for information and criteria for awards that will become available.
Once you have completed one academic year at the university, you may be eligible for an in-course scholarship. Visit the SAFA website for all eligibility criteria.

You can request an official receipt for proof of tuition by emailing connect@uoit.ca; you will be charged a $10 fee. Official receipts cannot be used for tax purposes.

If you don’t require an official receipt but want a breakdown of your fees, you can view and print your account detail by term on MyCampus, under the Undergraduate tab.

1. Log in to MyCampus.                                                                                                                          2. Click on Self Service Options (top right-hand corner).
3. Select Student Information - UOIT.
4. Select Paying Your Fees.
5. Select Account Detail by Term.
6. View your net tuition balance.

The payment deadline schedule is posted online, as well as on the Undergraduate tab of MyCampus. It is your responsibility to be aware of any important dates that apply to you, and ensure all account fees are paid on time. If your fees are not paid by the deadline, your account will be subject to a late fee.

Late fees are charged on a monthly basis of 1.5 per cent interest on the outstanding balance of your tuition account.

International students can apply for the Global Leadership Award, an application-based award that requires students to submit an online application, along with reference letters from teachers and/or community members.

When an offer is accepted on OUAC, it can take approximately 2 to 3 working days for your acceptance to register in our system. Continue to monitor the confirmation deposit page during that time period to make your payment.

OSAP funding is not released until the beginning of September, once we confirm that you are registered in your classes. As such, the $500 non-refundable confirmation deposit is typically not covered by OSAP.

To drop a course via your MyCampus account, go to the add/drop courses screen. Select web drop from the drop-down menu to the left of the CRN that you wish to drop. Click on submit changes at the bottom of the screen. If your course has been successfully deleted, it will be removed from your current schedule.
There are three periods throughout the year to apply for graduation online via MyCampus—view the intake periods for the application to graduate.
No. Tickets are not issued for the convocation ceremony, however, we ask that graduates only bring a maximum of five guests to ensure that all individuals are accommodated.
Here is a link to all the course registration terms: https://registrar.uoit.ca/faqs/registering-for-courses.php#accordion1

Follow the instructions on how to provide a letter of invitation for your guest(s), as you must write this letter yourself. 

If you apply to graduate during the winter semester, you will receive notification by the end of May regarding the outcome of your application. If you are an international student, you have access to download a verification of enrolment letter which includes your program of study, year level, current status as a student (full-time or part-time) and your expected graduation date.

To generate your letters, log in to MyCampus and select the verification of enrolment letter link, under the Student Records section of the Undergraduate tab.

To officially withdraw after you have registered for courses, you must complete and submit a withdrawal form to the Office of the Registrar. The withdrawal form can be found by logging in to MyCampus and going to the Documents tab.

Students must return their laptop within seven working days of withdrawal from their program. After this time, a late return charge will apply and/or the laptop will be deemed lost or stolen and appropriate action will be taken to retrieve it. Students are responsible for fees related to damage, misuse, loss or theft as per the policy. No refunds will be processed and student marks may be withheld until the matter is resolved.
Here is a link to all the course registration errors: https://registrar.uoit.ca/faqs/registering-for-courses.php#accordion3

If you have never logged in to the system, make sure that you are entering your date of birth correctly (it must be entered in the format MMDDYY). If you are still having difficulties, please call IT Services at 905.721.3333.
Here is a link for all classroom locations: https://registrar.uoit.ca/faqs/registering-for-courses.php#accordion2

Electives, general electives or open electives may be chosen from any course in the list of offerings, including those offered by Trent University. However, some courses are restricted from degree credit in some programs. Be sure to read the calendar regulations carefully and ensure that electives will meet your program requirements. If you are unsure, contact your academic advisor.

If the lab section you were trying to switch into was full, you were not added to that section. However, you were removed from your original lab section and the corresponding lecture because the lab that you dropped is linked to that lecture. In order to best avoid this happening, please check the availability of course sections prior to dropping a class.

Contact Information and Client Services to see if you are eligible to submit a late application to graduate.

Note: there is a $40 application fee for late applications

Official transcripts must be requested online via MyCampus, under the Undergraduate tab (Graduate tab for graduate students).  Looks for the academic transcript link on the right-hand sidebar under Student Records.  If you have lost access to MyCampus due to inactivity, call IT Services at 905.721.3333 to regain access to your account.

Getting to classes on time is important! If you are commuting by public transit, learn more about where your U-Pass can take you, and get to know your bus routes and how long it will take you to get here.

Follow the instructions on MyCampus, under the UOIT Undergraduate tab, to log in to your UOITnet and Blackboard accounts for the first time. The links to access these accounts are located in the top right-hand corner of your MyCampus account.

If you are planning on living on campus, there are many options for residences and meal plans that are overseen by Residence Services. Through them, you can learn what you need to know about life in residence, including:      Booking a residence tour.     Applying for residence.     Payments, including your residence deposit.     Different meal plan options.     Move-in and move-out dates.  If you have any questions about residence or meal plans, email info@dc-uoitrez.ca.

Laptop pickup runs from Monday, August 27 to Friday, September 28—you will need to book a session through MyCampus. If you are in one of the following faculties, you are part of the Full TELE model and will need to book a laptop pickup session:      Faculty of Business and Information Technology (Game Development and Entrepreneurship students only)     Faculty of Energy Systems and Nuclear Science     Faculty of Engineering and Applied Science  For more information on the Full TELE model, visit the Information and Technology Services website.

If you need a verification of enrolment letter for RESP purposes, banking institutions, study permits, etc., you can print one from MyCampus, under the Undergraduate tab. Look for the verification of enrolment letter link on the right-hand sidebar under Student Records. You may use these letters in place of the forms that require our stamp and signature, as they are considered official for this purpose.  Note: You must first be registered in fall and winter classes for the letters to generate. Verification of enrolment letters cannot be provided prior to course registration.  If you are a graduate student, please fill out the Verification of Enrolment form from the School of Graduate and Postdoctoral Studies.
You can request an appointment by calling our office at 905.721.3190.

Laptop pickup runs from Monday, August 27 to Friday, September 28—you will need to book a session through MyCampus. If you are in one of the following faculties, you are part of the Full TELE model and will need to book a laptop pickup session:      Faculty of Business and Information Technology (Game Development and Entrepreneurship students only)     Faculty of Energy Systems and Nuclear Science     Faculty of Engineering and Applied Science  For more information on the Full TELE model, visit the Information and Technology Services website.

Registration for the fall and winter semesters will open at the end of June. You will be sent further communication to your UOITnet account regarding registration closer to this time. The course preview will become available by mid-June, so you can begin planning their schedules prior to course registration.  As always, check the Undergraduate tab of MyCampus for updates as they become available.  Graduate students will receive an email to their UOITnet account with registration instructions and dates. Please contact the School of Graduate and Postdoctoral Studies with any questions about graduate registration.

Your campus identification (ID) card is one of the most important pieces of ID you have on campus. A valid card permits your access to many important facilities, resources and services. Once you have registered for your courses, you can get your campus ID card from Campus ID Services.  You can get your Campus ID card from the Campus ID Office, located in room G-1004 in the Campus Recreation and Wellness Centre (CRWC). You are required to bring one piece of valid government-issued photo ID and proof of registration (e.g. your timetable). If you are a returning student, you must bring your previous student ID card in order to pick up your new one.

Yes, our team can complete a CPP form for you. Visit our office with government-issued photo ID—you are welcome to wait for us to complete the form on the spot for you, or leave it with us to pick up at a later time.
